com.j256.ormlite.android
Class AndroidConnectionSource

java.lang.Object
  com.j256.ormlite.support.BaseConnectionSource
      com.j256.ormlite.android.AndroidConnectionSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConnectionSource
public class AndroidConnectionSource
extends BaseConnectionSource
implements ConnectionSource

Android version of the connection source. Uses the standard Android SQLiteOpenHelper. For best results, use our helper,

Author:
kevingalligan, graywatson
See Also:
OrmLiteSqliteOpenHelper

saveSpecialConnection

public boolean saveSpecialConnection(DatabaseConnection connection)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: ConnectionSource
Save this connection and return it for all calls to ConnectionSource.getReadOnlyConnection() and ConnectionSource.getReadWriteConnection() unless the ConnectionSource.clearSpecialConnection(DatabaseConnection) method is called, all This is used by the transaction mechanism since since all operations within a transaction must operate on the same connection. It is also used by the Android code during initialization.

NOTE: This should be a read-write connection since transactions and Android need it to be so.

NOTE: Saving a connection is usually accomplished using ThreadLocals so multiple threads should not be using connections in this scenario.

Specified by:
saveSpecialConnection in interface ConnectionSource
Returns:
True if the connection was saved or false if we were already inside of a saved connection.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
